data.author: Daniel Petti
data.message:
Fix a bug in the GPS time parsing.

This causes it to emit incorrect time reference messages if the
system time is off the GPS time by more than a second.

data.author: Ed Venator
data.message:
Update CI to latest setup-ros version (#158)

Update setup-ros to v0.4 to fix the OpenSSL issues caused by ros-tooling/setup-ros#515

data.author: Gabriel Gaessler
data.message:
Fix rare startup bug in case there is a time but no date (#144)

Signed-off-by: Gabriel Gaessler <gabriel.gaessler@de.bosch.com>

data.author: Gabriel Gaessler
data.message:
Extend workflow time and fix debian serial port bug (#145)

Fix the Github workflow CI build:
- Extend the timeout from 10 minutes to 30 minutes because the worker was observed idling 9 minutes of the 10 minute threshold in https://github.com/ros-drivers/nmea_navsat_driver/runs/5672759022?check_suite_focus=true.
- Change how the virtual serial port script waits for the ports, because the ROS buildfarm debian builder seems to have an inconsistent behavior concerning the time it takes to open virtual serial ports, causing the build to crash sometimes.

data.author: Gabriel Gaessler
data.message:
Add automated testing (via catkin_virtualenv) (#136)

Automatically test the code on every push or PR by playing back data to the driver and test whether the expected amount of messages is outputted by the driver and the messages contain the expected data.

The tester can cover more functionality that the current version of the nmea_navsat_driver supports, for these features new PRs will be created. The full usage can be observed in the boschresearch fork.

Signed-off-by: Gabriel Gaessler <gabriel.gaessler@de.bosch.com>

data.author: Ed Venator
data.message:
Update license (#125)

Change the license identifier in package.xml to conform to SPDX, add a license text file, and install
the license text file in accordance with the terms of the BSD 3-clause license.

data.author: Ed Venator
data.message:
Decode lines from the UDP server before passing them to the driver (#122)

RosNMEADriver.add_sentence() expects the first argument to be a str, not a bytes object.
This was properly decoded in the other node types, but not in the UDP socket server.

data.author: Ed Venator
data.message:
Fix #115 Decoding errors. (#116)

Handle decoding errors when reading from a
serial port. NMEA sentences should be ASCII-
encoded, but if malformed data comes in
from the serial port, it won't decode properly.
If the exception isn't handled, the node will
crash. This commonly happens on startup.

Also a couple of codestyle fixes.

Signed-off-by: Ed Venator <evenator@gmail.com>

data.author: Ed Venator
data.message:
Fix UTC time parsing #105 (#106)

If a UTC time string is of the format HHMMSS instead
of HHMMSS.SS, as observed on some Garmin receivers,
GPGGA message parsing would fail with a ValueError.

Only attempt to parse nanoseconds if the UTC time string
is long enough.

Signed-off-by: Ed Venator <evenator@gmail.com>

data.author: Ed Venator
data.message:
Fix lint in doc config python (#117)

Fix Python formatting.

data.author: Ed Venator
data.message: Changelog for Noetic release.

data.author: Ed Venator
data.message:
Update to Python3 for ROS Noetic (#113)

- CMake minimum version is now 3.0.2
- Python version is now 3
- Package.xml version is now 3

Tested on ROS Noetic in Ubuntu 20.04 (Focal) under Windows Subsystem for Linux. Serial drivers working as expected.

data.author: Ed Venator
data.message:
Fix valid_fix check (#111) (#112)

valid_fix should be determined by checking if the fix_type is greater than 0, not the gps_qual. This was never correct, but it at least ran in Python 2. In Python 3, it causes a TypeError.

data.author: Ed Venator
data.message:
Add Sphinx and rosdoc configuration (#93)

Add the necessary configuration files to generate documentation using rosdoc and sphinx.

data.author: Ed Venator
data.message:
Add missing dependency on tf (#102)

When building the package and running the driver with minimal dependencies installed, a Python error appears because the dependency on tf is not declared in package.xml. Declare that dependency.

Fixes #62.

data.author: Maximilian von Unwerth
data.message:
Trim whitespace in nmea_topic_driver (#98)

nmea_topic_driver gets raw NMEA sentences. Those may contain carriage return and new lines, which do not pass the validation regex. Strip whitespace from the nmea sentence before processing for consistency with the parser validator.

data.author: Ed Venator
data.message:
Use a regex to split tokens in parser (#87)

NMEA uses a * character to delimit the beginning of the regex, so use a regex that matches * and , as the field delimiter.

data.author: Ryan Govostes
data.message:
Rewrite nmea_socket_driver to use serversocket (#92)

Use Python's SocketServer rather than low level socket APIs. This simplifies code and makes it easier to add TCP support in the future. The buffer_size parameter is no longer necessary because this is an internal detail of UDPServer.

data.author: Ed Venator
data.message:
Add documentation (#91)

- Add documentation that passes pydocstyle.
- Clean up code to pass pycodestyle.

data.author: Ed Venator
data.message:
Add documentation and clean up (#88)

- Add documentation that passes pydocstyle.
- Clean up code to pass pycodestyle.

data.author: Xiangyang Zhi
data.message:
Add an Option to Use GNSS Time and Improve Time Parsing (#79)

- Add an optional parameter `use_GNSS_time` to use the time from the GPS sentences for ROS message time instead of using system time.
- Improve GPS time parsing to support nanosecond precision on devices that support it.
- Improve GPS time parsing to use RMC message for date when available.
- Improve GPS time parsing to resolve ambiguities in date and century using system time.

data.author: Ed Venator
data.message:
Refactor all nodes into entrypoint scripts (#76)

Move all of the actual code for each node into its own module
in a new "nodes" package within libnmea_navsat_driver.

Make each script only 2 lines: import and call main().

This will reduce the difference between ROS 1 and ROS 2 code,
because ROS 2 uses Python entry points to install executables.

Addresses #75

data.author: Ed Venator
data.message:
Fix PEP8 Violations (#68)

Fix #67 for ROS 1:

- Use autopep8 and a few manual fixes so that all Python modules and scripts
pass `pycodestyle --max-line-length 120 src/libnmea_navsat_driver/ scripts/*`
- Add setup.cfg file that specifies pycodestyle settings

data.author: diasdm
data.message:
Add nmea_serial_driver launch file (#60)

Add example nmea_serial_driver launch file.

data.author: Tony Baltovski
data.message:
Removed roslint as build depend. (#59)

roslint was accidentally re-added as a build dependency in #25.

data.author: Ed Venator
data.message:
Remove automatic prefixing of forward slash to frame_id. (#33/#57)

Removed the automatic prefixing of forward slash, but to be consistent with the current default behavior, the default frame_id has been set to /gps with the prepended forward slash.

data.author: Ed Venator
data.message:
Add support for IMU aided GPS systems (#30/#58)

* Adds support for IMU aided GPS systems like the Applanix POS/MV, whose NMEA strings typically begin '$IN'. (e.g. $INGGA).

* Adds support for VTG messages, which contain Course Over Ground and Speed Made Good. These are useful when not using RMC messages and you don't have a heading sensor.

data.author: Lee Hicks
data.message:
Publish heading (#25)

Add support for publishing heading from GPHDT as a `QuanternionStamped` message to a new topic `/heading`.

data.author: Nick Sullivan
data.message:
Improve Covariance Estimation (#46)

Use GST covariance where available, otherwise uses default covariances estimated from fix type.

The previous implementation set covariance to HDOP^2. Instead, it should multiply that by the measurement variance. HDOP should be greater than 1.0.

data.author: Loy
data.message:
Add Socket Driver (#32)

Add a NMEA socket driver node, which is like the existing serial driver node, but instead of attaching to a TTY handle from a serial port, it listens to a UDP port for NMEA sentences.

data.author: Vikrant Shah
data.message:
Add code to handle serial exception to allow node to exit cleanly (#52)

- Catch Serial exceptions and exit cleanly, instead of printing Python stack trace.
- Catch Serial exception when opening the serial port, log a FATAL message, and exit instead of printing Python stack trace.

data.author: Andreas Flåten
data.message:
Remove MSL compensation (#36)

Fix for #29 Altitude vs Elipsoid Height.

data.author: Mike Purvis
data.message:
Cleanup of CMakeLists, package.xml. (#28)

By going to package format 2, we can make roslint a test depend rather than build depend.

data.author: Eric Perko
data.message:
Merge pull request #38 from ros-drivers/update-maintainer

Update maintainer to Ed Venator

data.author: Edward Venator
data.message:
Update maintainer to Ed Venator

Also, remove boilerplate comments from package.xml

data.author: Timo Röhling
data.message:
Add GLONASS support

GLONASS capable devices send different NMEA sentences, which are
basically identical to the GPS sentences, but with other prefixes.

data.author: Patrick Barone
data.message:
Updated driver to accept status of 9 which some novatel recievers report for a WAAS (SBAS) fix.

See http://www.novatel.com/support/known-solutions/which-novatel-position-types-correspond-to-the-gga-quality-indicator/
